unnormalised: Energy & Utilities News Snippet: Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Pace Across India
normalised: energy and utilities news snippet: smart meter rollout gathers pace across India

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide smart meter deployment is gaining momentum, with significant progress reported across several states. Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (UPPCL) announced the installation of 2.5 lakh smart meters by the end of Q3 2024. This initiative aims to reduce AT&C losses, currently estimated at Rs. 45,000 crore annually.

Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited (U P P C L) announced the installation of two point five lakh smart meters by the end of Q three two thousand and twenty four. This initiative aims to reduce A T and C losses, currently estimated at rupee forty five thousand crore annually.

unnormalised: In Maharashtra, the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) plans to replace conventional meters with smart meters in Pune and Nagpur by December 31, 2024, covering nearly 1 million households. The project, funded under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS), aims to enhance grid stability and facilitate real-time monitoring of electricity consumption.
